name: Caipirinha
instructions: Muddle lime and sugar in a {glowball glass} until the lime is juiced. Fill to brim with crushed ice and add cachaça. Garnish with sugar cane.
notes: Proper Brazilian Caipirinhas are unmeasured. The glass is simply filled with cachaça after the ice is added.

name: Gin and Tonic
instructions: Mix ingredients {ghighball glass} filled with ice. Garnish with a wedge of lime.

name: The Last Word
instructions: Shake vigorously with ice. Strain into a {gcocktail glass} and garnish with a twist of lime.

name: Ivy
instructions: Shake with ice for a long time. Strain into a chilled {gcocktail glass}.

name: Rum & Coke
instructions: Build ingredients in a {glowball glass} filled with ice.

name: Dark & Stormy
instructions: Pour ginger beer into a {ghighball glass} filled with ice. Top off with rum.

name: Long Island Iced Tea
instructions: Mix ingredients in a {ghighball glass} over ice.

name: Chateau Romani
instructions: Pour alcohol in a shaker with ice and shake vigorously. Strain into a small glass and fill with milk.

name: Brinstar
instructions: Muddle the lime, simple syrup, and mint together in a shaker. Add ice and the alcohol and shake well. Pour the mixture into a {glowball glass}.
notes: Brinstar is a zone overgrown with vegetation. Having very recently been introduced to a lime-y cocktail known as a caipirinha, I decided to try combining it with another leafy drink - namely, a mojito. The resulting combination, plus a little extra, wound up being a tasty creation that I’m rather proud of.

name: Vesper Martini
instructions: Shake over ice until well chilled, then strain into a deep {ggoblet} and garnish with lemon peel.
notes: This is what James Bond used to drink before he switched to vodka martinis.

name: Corpse Reviver #2
instructions: Shake ingredients together in a mixer with ice. Strain into chilled {gcocktail glass}.

name: Improved Whiskey Cocktail
instructions: Combine liquid ingredients in an ice-filled mixing glass and stir until cold. Strain into a chilled {gcocktail glass}. Cut a thin slice of lemon zest over the surface of the drink and drop it into the glass.

name: Mudslide
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and pour over ice in a {gcocktail glass}. Garnish with a little chocolate syrup on the inside of the glass.

name: Lumière
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a large glass filled with ice. Stir thoroughly and strain the mixture into a {gcoupe}. Garnish with a lime twist.

name: Margarita
instructions: Rim a {gmargarita glass} with salt. Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into the glass. Garnish with a wheel of lime.

name: Bee's Knees
instructions: Shake ingredients well with ice. Strain into a chilled {gcocktail glass} and garnish with a wedge of lemon.

name: Death in the Afternoon
instructions: Pour one jigger absinthe into a Champagne glass. Add iced Champagne until it attains the proper opalescent milkiness. Drink three to five of these slowly.

name: Angostura Sour
instructions: Pour the egg white and lime juice into a cocktail shaker and shake for 30 seconds. Add the bitters and syrup, fill with ice and shake hard for another 30 seconds. Strain into a chilled {gcocktail glass}.

name: Manhattan
instructions: Stir gently over ice. Strain into a chilled {gcocktail glass} and garnish with a Maraschino cherry.

name: Brooklyn
instructions: Stir gently over ice. Strain into a chilled {gcocktail glass}.
notes: The bitters may be replaced with 1/4oz Amer Picon, a French version of Italy's Amaro.

name: White Lady
instructions: Shake well with cracked ice, then strain into a chilled {gcocktail glass}.

name: B-52
instructions: Layer ingredients into a shot glass (Kahlua, then Baileys, then Grand Marnier).

name: La Palabra
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice, then strain into a {gcocktail glass}.
notes: A variant on the Last Word.

name: Revolver
instructions: Combine bourbon, coffee liqueur, and orange bitters in a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir well until chilled, about 30 seconds. Strain into chilled {gcocktail glass}. Twist orange peel to express oils over drink and use as garnish.
notes: A rye-heavy bourbon such as Bulleit, Buffalo Trace or Basil Hayden is recommended.

name: Chrysanthemum
instructions: Stir ingredients with ice until well chilled, then strain into a chilled {gcocktail glass} and garnish with an orange peel.

name: El Presidente
instructions: Combine ingredients in an ice-filled mixing glass and stir until cold. Strain into a chilled {gcocktail glass}. Optionally garnish with an orange zest and piece of pineapple.
notes: Dry vermouth also works. When using dry vermouth, the drink benefits from increasing the amount of rum by 1/4 ounce or so, but it works well either way.

name: Derby
instructions: Shake ingredients over ice and strain into a chilled {gcocktail glass}. Garnish with lime wedge or mint leaf.

name: Ginger Gold Rush
instructions: Put a brandied cherry in the bottom of a {gmartini glass}. Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake vigorously and strain over the cherry into the glass.
notes: The original recipe has the reverse proportions for the ginger and bourbon, which makes for a significantly sweeter drink.

name: Alamagoozlum
instructions: Shake very hard over ice and strain into a chilled {gcocktail glass}.

name: Martinez
instructions: Stir with ice until very cold and strain into a chilled {gcocktail glass}. Garnish with a twist of lemon.

name: Chartreuse Smash
instructions: Place mint, lemon and sugar in a cocktail shaker and muddle. Add Chartreuse and fill with ice. Shake thoroughly, and strain into a glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with mint sprig.

name: Perfect Margarita
instructions: Rim a {gmargarita glass} with salt. Briefly shake all ingredients with ice and strain with a fine mesh strainer into the glass. Garnish with lime or a slice of jalapeño.

name: Improved Holland Gin Cocktail
instructions: Combine ingredients in bar glass, add good solid ice and stir until well chilled. Strain the mixture over a 2" square ice cube in a frosted {gold fashioned glass}. Garnish with fresh lemon peel.

name: Diamondback
instructions: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass filled with ice. Stir well, strain into a chilled cocktail glass and serve.
